reading: Read 2 news articles daily and summarize key points in 3 bullets.
Build a personal glossary of 10 new words per day.
listening: Listen to one 10-minute academic talk; write a 5-sentence summary.
Shadow native audio for 5 minutes focusing on rhythm/intonation.
Do one timed Section 1/2 practice with note-taking.
writing: Task 1: describe a chart in 20 minutes; swap verbs to avoid repetition.
Task 2: write a 250-word essay; check topic sentences and cohesion.
Use a 4-part checklist: idea → structure → grammar → review.
speaking: Record a 2-minute talk on a cue card; replay and note fillers.
Daily Q&A: answer 5 common interview questions out loud.
Pair practice: alternate between examiner and candidate roles.
mixed: Mock mini-test: 30 minutes rotating R/L/W/S micro-tasks.
Error log review: pick 3 mistakes from the week and fix them.
